title: Gender, Smoking History and Age Prediction from Laryngeal Images. (arXiv:2305.16661v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: Flexible laryngoscopy is commonly performed by otolaryngologists to detect laryngeal diseases and to recognize potentially malignant lesions. Recently, researchers have introduced machine learning techniques to facilitate automated diagnosis using laryngeal images and achieved promising results. Diagnostic performance can be improved when patients' demographic information is incorporated into models. However, manual entry of patient data is time consuming for clinicians. In this study, we made the first endeavor to employ deep learning models to predict patient demographic information to improve detector model performance. The overall accuracy for gender, smoking history, and age was 85.5%, 65.2%, and 75.9%, respectively. We also created a new laryngoscopic image set for machine learning study and benchmarked the performance of 8 classical deep learning models based on CNNs and Transformers. The results can be integrated into current learning models to improve their performance by inco

Title: Gender, Smoking History and Age Prediction from Laryngeal Images. (arXiv:2305.16661v1 [cs.CV])
Abstract: Flexible laryngoscopy is commonly performed by otolaryngologists to detect laryngeal diseases and to recognize potentially malignant lesions. Recently, researchers have introduced machine learning techniques to facilitate automated diagnosis using laryngeal images and achieved promising results. Diagnostic performance can be improved when patients' demographic information is incorporated into models. However, manual entry of patient data is time consuming for clinicians. In this study, we made the first endeavor to employ deep learning models to predict patient demographic information to improve detector model performance. The overall accuracy for gender, smoking history, and age was 85.5%, 65.2%, and 75.9%, respectively. We also created a new laryngoscopic image set for machine learning study and benchmarked the performance of 8 classical deep learning models based on CNNs and Transformers. translated_title: 基于喉镜图像预测患者基本信息的深度学习模型
translated_abstract: 应用灵活喉镜检查可以检测喉部疾病和识别潜在的恶性病变。研究人员们最近开始应用机器学习技术使用喉镜图像进行自动诊断，取得了有希望的成果。本研究尝试首次采用深度学习模型预测患者的基本信息，从而提高检测器模型的性能。性别、吸烟史和年龄的准确率分别达到了85.5%、65.2%和75.9%。同时，我们还创造了一个全新的喉镜图像数据集，基于卷积神经网络和Transformer的8种经典深度学习模型的性能得到了测试，并可以将结果集成到当前的学习模型中。
tldr: 首次采用深度学习模型预测喉镜图像中的患者基本信息，从而提高检测器模型的性能。
en_tdlr: A deep learning model is proposed to predict patient demographic information from laryngeal images, improving the performance of detector models. The approach achieved high accuracy for gender, smoking history, and age prediction. In addition, a new laryngoscopic image set was created and the performance of 8 deep learning models was benchmarked, with potential for integration into current models.
